title: Web Engineering - Lecture 06: Responsive Web Design (RWD)

fill_in_the_blanks.question: ______ web design is all about creating websites that work well on any device.
Responsive design adapts website layouts to different ______, providing a consistent experience.
Instead of fixed-width layouts, RWD uses ______ systems.
Fluid grids use ______ for widths, so elements resize proportionally.
The CSS property ______ ensures images adjust to their container's size.
______ are used in CSS to apply different styles for different screen sizes and orientations.
One RWD principle is to prioritize ______, making buttons large enough for finger tapping.
Continuously testing a website on different devices and browsers is called ______.
A major advantage of responsive websites is an enhanced ______.
Having a responsive website can help rank higher on ______ (Search Engine Result Pages).
A responsive website helps to reduce the ______ rate, as it can be viewed on any device.
Media Queries are a CSS technique introduced in ______.
______ refers to the ability of a website to work correctly across multiple web browsers.
Tools like polyfills, frameworks, or libraries can be used to handle compatibility ______.
The goal of AI in web design is not to replace designers but to ______ their capabilities.
______ systems use machine learning to automatically generate the structure of a webpage.
AI can automatically adjust a layout for different screen sizes, which is known as ______.
A benefit of AI-driven layouts is the ______ barrier to entry for non-designers.
______ are AI-powered features integrated into the design process to assist with UI/UX.
Smart UI/UX tools use AI models for tasks like image recognition and ______ analytics.

true_false.question: Responsive Web Design (RWD) is primarily for desktop computers and not mobile devices.
Fluid grids use fixed pixel values for widths.
The CSS property `max-width: 100%` prevents images from overflowing their layout.
Media queries can only change font sizes, not the entire layout.
Prioritizing touchscreens means making buttons and interactive elements smaller.
Testing responsiveness is an optional final step in RWD.
A responsive website can improve a brand's SEO ranking.
A key principle of RWD is that the website should look completely different on every device to show uniqueness.
Using swipe gestures for mobile menus is an example of improving user engagement.
Responsive websites are mobile-friendly by design.
RWD can lead to an increase in a website's bounce rate.
Media Queries were introduced in CSS2.
Media queries allow a single codebase to adapt to different screen sizes.
Cross-browser compatibility ensures a website only works on Google Chrome.
Cross-browser compatibility is only concerned with different browsers, not different operating systems.
Using standardized HTML, CSS, and JavaScript helps achieve cross-browser compatibility.
The main goal of AI in web design is to replace human designers.
AI-driven layouts are trained on datasets of well-designed websites.
Wix ADI is an example of a Generative AI tool for website building.
Smart UI/UX tools primarily focus on server-side code generation.

mcqs.question: What is the primary goal of Responsive Web Design (RWD)?
options: To make websites work well and look good on any device
mcqs.answer: To make websites work well and look good on any device

mcqs.question: RWD ensures a consistent and ______ experience across devices.
Which of the following is the FIRST step listed in the RWD principles?
What do fluid grid systems use for widths to ensure elements resize proportionally?
Which principle of RWD involves using `max-width: 100%` on media content?
What is the purpose of using `max-width: 100%` on an image?
options: To fix the image width to 100 pixels
To prevent the image from overflowing its container
To hide the image on mobile
mcqs.answer: To prevent the image from overflowing its container

mcqs.question: What CSS3 technique allows you to apply different styles for different screen sizes?
Media queries can apply styles based on which of the following device characteristics?
The 'Prioritize Touchscreens' principle suggests that interactive elements should be:
Using tools and emulators to check your site on various screen sizes is part of which step?
What is a major advantage of responsive websites mentioned in the lecture?
How does a responsive website enhance SEO?
options: By ranking higher due to good traffic and UX
By creating separate URLs for each device
mcqs.answer: By ranking higher due to good traffic and UX

mcqs.question: Which RWD principle states that a website should be designed to work on mobiles, tablets, and PCs?
A clean, neat layout that helps users find what they need quickly relates to which principle?
Maintaining the same fonts and colors across phone, tablet, and computer views is an example of:
Using swipe gestures for menus on a mobile device is an example of which RWD principle?
What is a key benefit of RWD related to users leaving a site?
Why are responsive websites considered 'Mobile Friendly'?
options: They are only for mobile phones
Their layout changes when viewed on mobiles and tablets
They require a mobile app to be installed
mcqs.answer: Their layout changes when viewed on mobiles and tablets

mcqs.question: How does RWD help in increasing traffic?
options: By allowing viewers to use the website efficiently from multiple devices
mcqs.answer: By allowing viewers to use the website efficiently from multiple devices

mcqs.question: Which two concepts are described as essential for creating responsive and accessible websites?
Media Queries are a CSS technique introduced in which version of CSS?
Media queries allow styles to be applied based on the type of device, such as:
What is the primary benefit of using Media Queries?
What does 'Cross-Browser Compatibility' refer to?
options: A website that works in only one browser
A website that works correctly across multiple web browsers
A website that blocks certain browsers
A website that queries other browsers
mcqs.answer: A website that works correctly across multiple web browsers

mcqs.question: Cross-browser compatibility ensures proper display and functionality in browsers like:
Compatibility issues can include which of the following?
How is cross-browser compatibility often achieved?
options: By blocking users on unsupported browsers
By writing separate websites for each browser

mcqs.question: What are 'polyfills' used for?
options: To handle compatibility gaps between browsers
mcqs.answer: To handle compatibility gaps between browsers

mcqs.question: Achieving cross-browser compatibility is essential for:
options: Reaching a wider audience and reducing user frustration
Focusing on a single operating system
mcqs.answer: Reaching a wider audience and reducing user frustration

mcqs.question: How is AI transforming web design?
options: By making it a purely manual process
By making it collaborative, efficient, and data-driven
By eliminating the need for CSS
mcqs.answer: By making it collaborative, efficient, and data-driven

mcqs.question: What is the stated goal of AI in web design?
options: To focus only on high-level strategy

mcqs.question: AI in web design frees designers to focus on:
What are 'AI-Driven Layouts'?
options: Systems that use machine learning to automatically generate webpage structure
Layouts that only work on AI-powered devices
mcqs.answer: Systems that use machine learning to automatically generate webpage structure

mcqs.question: How do AI-driven layout systems 'learn' design principles?
options: By being trained on vast datasets of existing, well-designed websites
mcqs.answer: By being trained on vast datasets of existing, well-designed websites

mcqs.question: What input might you provide to an AI-driven layout generator?
options: A sitemap, content, or a rough sketch
mcqs.answer: A sitemap, content, or a rough sketch

mcqs.question: What is Wix ADI an example of?
options: A Generative AI tool for website building
mcqs.answer: A Generative AI tool for website building

mcqs.question: What is 'Refactoring & Adaptation' in the context of AI layouts?
options: AI automatically adjusting a layout for different screen sizes
mcqs.answer: AI automatically adjusting a layout for different screen sizes

mcqs.question: Which of the following is a benefit of AI-Driven Layouts?
options: Extreme Speed: Generates layouts in seconds
Produces a very narrow range of creative options
Raises the barrier to entry for non-designers
mcqs.answer: Extreme Speed: Generates layouts in seconds

mcqs.question: How do AI-driven layouts 'reduce guesswork'?
options: By asking the user many questions
By providing a single, perfect layout
By basing layouts on proven design patterns that perform well
By letting the designer choose from a list
mcqs.answer: By basing layouts on proven design patterns that perform well

mcqs.question: What is a benefit of AI-Driven Layouts for non-designers?
options: It allows them to create professionally-structured layouts
mcqs.answer: It allows them to create professionally-structured layouts

mcqs.question: What are 'Smart UI/UX Tools'?
options: Tools that replace the user interface
AI-powered features that assist with creating and refining the UI/UX
Design tools that only work on smartphones
mcqs.answer: AI-powered features that assist with creating and refining the UI/UX

mcqs.question: Smart UI/UX tools use specific AI models for tasks like:
options: Image recognition, NLP, and predictive analytics
mcqs.answer: Image recognition, NLP, and predictive analytics

mcqs.question: Where do Smart UI/UX tools typically work?
options: Within your design environment (like Figma or Sketch)
mcqs.answer: Within your design environment (like Figma or Sketch)

mcqs.question: Which of the following is listed as a key application of Smart UI/UX Tools?
Which of the following is NOT listed as an application of Smart UI/UX Tools?
Which of the following is a benefit of Smart UI/UX Tools?
Which of the following is NOT a benefit of Smart UI/UX Tools?
The concept of 'Refactoring & Adaptation' in AI layouts directly helps with which RWD principle?
options: Ensuring responsiveness across different screen sizes
mcqs.answer: Ensuring responsiveness across different screen sizes

mcqs.question: AI-driven layouts are 'data-informed choices' because they are based on:
RWD principle 'Viewable on Multiple Devices' is most closely related to which of these?
options: Ensuring the website works on mobiles, tablets, and PCs
Making the website easy to understand
Keeping fonts and colors the same
Allowing users to control the website
mcqs.answer: Ensuring the website works on mobiles, tablets, and PCs

mcqs.question: What is the 5th step listed for creating a responsive web design?
Which of these is NOT one of the 5 main steps of RWD principles?
Which of these is NOT one of the 4 'Key Principles of RWD' (starting on slide 9)?
Which of these is NOT listed as a benefit of RWD?
Media queries are a feature of:
What does 'RWD' stand for?
Which RWD principle specifically addresses layout adjustments based on screen size?
Wix ADI (Artificial Design Intelligence) is given as an example of:
AI-powered features working within Figma or Sketch are called:
The ability for AI to generate a full homepage in seconds is a benefit called:
